column1: The dark growth of scrub oak and pine parted suddenly and the lithe figure of a boy of about seventeen emerged suddenly into the little clearing. The lad who had so abruptly materialized from the close-growing vegetation peculiar to the region about the little town of Hampton
column2: on the south shore of Long Island
column3: wore a well-fitting uniform of brown khaki
column4: canvas leggings of the same hue and a soft hat of the campaign variety
column5: turned up at one side. To the front of his headpiece was fastened a metal badge
column6: resembling the three-pointed arrow head utilized on old maps to indicate the north. On a metal scroll beneath it were embossed the words: "Be Prepared."The manner of the badge's attachment would have indicated at once
column7: to any one familiar with the organization
column8: that the lad wearing it was the patrol leader of the local band of Boy Scouts.
